column1: A closed reduction can be done by an orthopedic surgeon (bone doctor) or a primary care provider who has experience doing this procedure.

A closed reduction can: - Help your bone heal quickly and be strong when it heals - Decrease pain - Improve the chances that your limb will look normal and you will be able to use it normally when it heals - Lower the risk of an infection in the bone
Your risk of any of these problems is greater if you: - Smoke - Take steroids (such as cortisone), birth control pills, or other hormones (such as insulin) - Are older - Have other health conditions
